channel.title: Tech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from Tech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Solo VC and Lovable investor Neil Murray raises third Nordic-focused fund
item.description: The Nordic Web closes $6M Fund III.

item.title: VCs discuss why most consumer AI startups still lack staying power
item.description: The next consumer tech revolution may require an introduction of a new personal device.

item.title: Lightspeed raises record $9B in fresh capital
item.description: The massive fund haul will allow the Silicon Valley firm to continue to invest in cash hungry AI startups.

item.title: Creative Commons announces tentative support for AI ‘pay-to-crawl’ systems
item.description: The organization offered support for this idea of an AI marketplace, and suggested several guiding principles.

item.title: Ford is starting a battery storage business to power data centers and the grid
item.description: Ford will invest about $2 billion into the new business over the next two years.

item.title: OpenAI-backed biotech firm Chai Discovery raises $130M Series B at $1.3B valuation
item.description: Chai is building foundation models for drug discovery, specifically to predict interactions between molecules so they could be reprogramed for cures.

item.title: Ford’s next F-150 Lightning will have a gas generator as it pivots away from large EVs
item.description: The company is abandoning plans for a brand new all-electric pickup truck codenamed "T3" and ending production of the battery-only Lightning.

item.title: Ford Kills the All-Electric F-150 as It Rethinks Its EV Ambitions
item.description: The move comes as a response to the Trump administration's waning support for electrification and a weakening consumer market.

item.title: I hate that I love Riverside’s AI-driven ‘Rewind’ for podcasters
item.description: Riverside's year-end review is amusing, but it represents a creative culture that's increasingly entwined with AI.

item.title: Disney’s OpenAI deal is exclusive for just one year — then it’s open season
item.description: After the one year is up, Disney is free to sign similar deals with other AI companies.
